content.text: What Is the Profit and Loss Statement?
The Profit and Loss (P&L) statement shows how much money a company earned and spent during a period. It starts with revenue and subtracts expenses to arrive at net profit.
It shows whether the business is profitable and how efficiently it operates. Investors track trends in revenue, expenses, and profit margins over time.
Revenue, operating expenses, interest, taxes, and net profit. Operating profit shows business strength before financial costs.
If revenue is ₹100 and total expenses are ₹80, net profit is ₹20. Profit margin = 20%. Higher margins usually indicate better business quality.
